intro: Ophiuros laevis, commonly known as the smooth sea holly, is a marine flowering plant belonging to the family Cystophoraceae. It is characterized by its fleshy, succulent stems and leaves that are typically smooth and glabrous. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in shallow coastal waters and is often found in sandy or muddy substrates. Ophiuros laevis plays a role in stabilizing coastal sediments and provides habitat for various marine organisms.
